CatDescriptText: Rachel Brown, 284 Wick Street and Ruth Bland, 712 Beltzhoover Avenue, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 2, 1957, pg. 2, with question: "Do you believe that one political party should be in control of all the offices in city, county, and state?" Mrs. Rachel Brown's answer reads: "No, I don't think that its good government. Since we have two political parties, the offices should be divided.  I don't think that one political party should be in charge of all the officies."  Mrs. Ruth Bland's answer reads: "No, because I believe that the other party's point of view should be heard.  To have both sides presented gives variety.  You don't want to come home to the same menu every night."
TitMainTitle: Rachel Brown wearing light colored uniform, conical hat, and small round brooch, and Ruth Bland, standing against wall
